column4: Could somebody take a look at this log http://paste.ubuntu.com/734107/ and tell me what is wrong? My laptop won't boot an this is driving me nuts!!
at what poingt does it stop?
at boot it leaves me with a black screen doing normal boot, and shows some text if i boot in recovery, but it would freeze either
what gpu do you use?
did you upgrade from Natty to Oneiric?
you may need to drop to root recovery console and run: nvidia-xconfig
the problem is that i can't get into recovery mode
sure you can, hold shift at boot, select recovery mode, select root
no way, the laptop would freeze after i select that entry on grub, it would not get to the ncurses dialog where you select what kind of recovery task you want to do
the pastebin i posted earlier cotains the logs of two boots, the first through normal mode and the second in recovery mode
then boot to liveCD and you can chroot
i'm on livecd now, what should i do?
http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/09/live-usb-sticking-grub-2-video/    instead of the grub install stuff run: sudo nvidia-xconfig
got this output http://paste.ubuntu.com/734125/ is it ok?
if that's in the chroot, then yes it's fine
so now i  reboot and everything should work?
maybe, try it :)
i have rebooted and nothing has changed
hmm, ok remove the file from the partition
what file_
what file should i remove?
the xorg.conf file you made
done. what now?
not sure dude, could chroot and uninstall the proprietary driver and reboot
